DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to evaluate influence of atorvastin on the repolarisation phase of cardiomyocytes. If there is any, it could be a part of positive "non-lipid" effect of statins in therapy of ischaemic heart disease. Study hypothesis: atorvastin will decrease heterogeneity of repolarisation of cardiomyocytes in comparison with placebo
DOC.brief_title: Study of Influence of Atorvastatin on the Repolarisation Phase of Cardiomyocytes
DOC.detailed_description: The group will consist of 40 healthy volunteers. The study will be mono-centric. The repolarisation phase of cardiomyocytes will be evaluated using long - term 12-lead digital ECG monitoring. There will be 3 single ECG recordings - randomly after 20 mg of atorvastin, 80 mg of atorvastatin and placebo, respectively.
DOC.criteria: signed informed consent age 18 45 years no chronic active disease no concomitant pharmacotherapy, excluding hormonal contraception abnormal ECG, echocardiography, laboratory findings known hypersensitivity or myopathy due o statin pregnancy, lactation, breast implants skin disease
